definition:
A $\kappa$- $T$ for which $|T_\alpha|<\kappa$ for all $\alpha<\kappa$
and which has no cofinal branches is called a *$\kappa$-Aronszajn tree*.
If $\kappa=\omega_1$ then it is referred to simply as an Aronszajn tree.

If there are no $\kappa$-Aronszajn trees for some $\kappa$ then we say
$\kappa$ has the *tree property*. $\omega$ has the tree property, but no
singular cardinal has the tree property.
